context: Mid-size university seeking to enhance STEM education through VR technology implementation across science and engineering departments

request.purpose: VR laboratory equipment, software licenses, faculty training, and content development for immersive STEM education
request.justification: Competitive advantage in student recruitment, improved learning outcomes, and alignment with industry 4.0 skills requirements

business_impact.expected_outcome: Enhanced student engagement, improved learning retention, increased STEM enrollment
business_impact.projected_value: $750,000 annual savings in lab equipment costs, $1.2M in research grants

decision_criteria: Educational impact and learning outcomes improvement
lessons_learned: Early stakeholder engagement critical for technology adoption, phased implementation reduces risk, comprehensive training essential for faculty buy-in
